data.title: Henry Cavill
data.meta_description: I was more than happy with Henry Cavill's appearance as The Witcher. He's a real professional. Just as Viggo Mortensen gave his face to Aragorn, so Henry gave his to Geralt â€” and it shall be forever so. Andrzej Sapkowski, speaking to PEOPLE.com Henry Cavill (b. 5 May 1983) is a British actor who...
data.text:
Henry Cavill (b. 5 May 1983) is a British actor who portrayed Geralt of Rivia in Netflix's The Witcher from seasons 1-3.[1] He is a self professed "witcher-nerd", having read the books and played all the games twice, which helped him get the role.

He later stepped down from playing as Geralt, with Liam Hemsworth taking over in season 4.[1]

Major works[]

Man of Steel (2013) - as Superman

Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice (2016) - as Superman

Justice League (2017) - as Superman

Mission Impossible - Fallout (2018) - as August Walker/John Lark

Trivia[]

Cavill is known to be an avid gamer to the point he missed a phone call asking him to play Superman because he was too busy playing World of Warcraft.

When asked who he chooses, Triss or Yennefer, Cavill notes when he played the games, and especially after reading the books, he feels at Geralt's core it's Yennefer and even when he can choose in the games, Cavill always goes for Yennefer.[2]
